elements.desc:
`` is a generalized element that is useful when you have hidden content (`.dropdown-content`) that is revealed due to some change in state that should cause it to do so. Note that this is a low-level element intended to be used as part of other composite elements that cause dropdowns to be revealed. Examples of elements that might be implemented using an `iron-dropdown` include comboboxes, menubuttons, selects. The list goes on. The `` element exposes attributes that allow the position of the `.dropdown-content` relative to the `.dropdown-trigger` to be configured.
Hello!
 In the above example, the `
` with class `.dropdown-content` will be hidden until the dropdown element has `opened` set to true, or when the `open` method is called on the element.

properties.name: addOwnKeyBinding
properties.desc:
Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
element. This is the imperative equivalent of declaring a keybinding
in the `keyBindings` prototype property.

properties.name: allowOutsideScroll
properties.desc:
By default, the dropdown will constrain scrolling on the page
to itself when opened.
Set to true in order to prevent scroll from being constrained
to the dropdown when it opens.

properties.name: animationConfig
properties.desc: Animation configuration. See README for more info.

properties.name: assignParentResizable
properties.desc:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

properties.name: autoFitOnAttach
properties.desc: Set to true to auto-fit on attach.

properties.name: backdropElement
properties.desc: The backdrop element.

properties.name: cancel
properties.desc: Cancels the overlay.

properties.name: cancelAnimation
properties.desc: Cancels the currently running animation.

properties.name: canceled
properties.desc: True if the overlay was canceled when it was last closed.

properties.name: center
properties.desc:
Centers horizontally and vertically if not already positioned. This also sets
`position:fixed`.

properties.name: close
properties.desc: Close the overlay.

properties.name: closeAnimationConfig
properties.desc:
An animation config. If provided, this will be used to animate the
closing of the dropdown.

properties.name: closingReason
properties.desc: Returns the reason this dialog was last closed.

properties.name: constrain
properties.desc:
Constrains the size of the element to the window or `fitInfo` by setting `max-height`
and/or `max-width`.

properties.name: containedElement
properties.desc: The element that is contained by the dropdown, if any.

properties.name: disabled
properties.desc: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

properties.name: entryAnimation
properties.desc:
Convenience property for setting an 'entry' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.entry`
manually if using this. The animated node is set to `this` if using this property.

properties.name: exitAnimation
properties.desc:
Convenience property for setting an 'exit' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.exit`
manually if using this. The animated node is set to `this` if using this property.

properties.name: fit
properties.desc: Fits and optionally centers the element into the window, or `fitInfo` if specified.

properties.name: fitInto
properties.desc: The element to fit `this` into.

properties.name: focused
properties.desc: If true, the element currently has focus.

properties.name: focusTarget
properties.desc:
If provided, this will be the element that will be focused when
the dropdown opens.

properties.name: getAnimationConfig
properties.desc:
An element implementing `Polymer.NeonAnimationRunnerBehavior` calls this method to configure
an animation with an optional type. Elements implementing `Polymer.NeonAnimatableBehavior`
should define the property `animationConfig`, which is either a configuration object
or a map of animation type to array of configuration objects.

properties.name: horizontalAlign
properties.desc:
The orientation against which to align the dropdown content
horizontally relative to the dropdown trigger.

properties.name: horizontalOffset
properties.desc:
A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the
given `horizontalAlign`. Use a negative value to offset to the
left, or a positive value to offset to the right.

properties.name: keyEventTarget
properties.desc: The HTMLElement that will be firing relevant KeyboardEvents.

properties.name: noAnimations
properties.desc:
Set to true to disable animations when opening and closing the
dropdown.

properties.name: noAutoFocus
properties.desc:
Set to true to disable auto-focusing the overlay or child nodes with
the `autofocus` attribute` when the overlay is opened.

properties.name: noCancelOnEscKey
properties.desc: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay with the ESC key.

properties.name: noCancelOnOutsideClick
properties.desc: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay by clicking outside it.

properties.name: notifyResize
properties.desc:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

properties.name: open
properties.desc: Open the overlay.

properties.name: openAnimationConfig
properties.desc:
An animation config. If provided, this will be used to animate the
opening of the dropdown.

properties.name: opened
properties.desc: True if the overlay is currently displayed.

properties.name: playAnimation
properties.desc: Plays an animation with an optional `type`.

properties.name: positionTarget
properties.desc:
The element that should be used to position the dropdown when
it is opened.

properties.name: refit
properties.desc:
Equivalent to calling `resetFit()` and `fit()`. Useful to call this after the element,
the window, or the `fitInfo` element has been resized.

properties.name: removeOwnKeyBindings
properties.desc: When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

properties.name: resetFit
properties.desc:
Resets the target element's position and size constraints, and clear
the memoized data.

properties.name: resizerShouldNotify
properties.desc:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.desc:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

properties.name: sizingTarget
properties.desc:
The element that will receive a `max-height`/`width`. By default it is the same as `this`,
but it can be set to a child element. This is useful, for example, for implementing a
scrolling region inside the element.

properties.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
properties.desc:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

properties.name: toggle
properties.desc: Toggle the opened state of the overlay.

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.desc:
The orientation against which to align the dropdown content
vertically relative to the dropdown trigger.

properties.name: verticalOffset
properties.desc:
A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the
given `verticalAlign`. Use a negative value to offset towards the
top, or a positive value to offset towards the bottom.

properties.name: withBackdrop
properties.desc: Set to true to display a backdrop behind the overlay.

properties.name: _defaultPositionTarget
properties.desc:
The element that should be used to position the dropdown when
it opens, if no position target is configured.

properties.name: _discoverInfo
properties.desc: Memoize information needed to position and size the target element.

properties.name: _focusContent
properties.desc: Focuses the configured focus target.

properties.name: _focusTarget
properties.desc: The element that should be focused when the dropdown opens.

properties.name: _horizontalAlignTargetValue
properties.desc: The horizontal offset value used to position the dropdown.

properties.name: _imperativeKeyBindings
properties.desc: own properties of everything on the "prototype".

properties.name: _notifyingDescendant
properties.desc:
True if this element is currently notifying its descedant elements of
resize.

properties.name: _onIronResize
properties.desc: Called when an `iron-resize` event fires.

properties.name: _onNeonAnimationFinish
properties.desc:
Called when animation finishes on the dropdown (when opening or
closing). Responsible for "completing" the process of opening or
closing the dropdown by positioning it or setting its display to
none.

properties.name: _openedChanged
properties.desc: Called when the value of `opened` changes.

params.name: opened
params.desc: True if the dropdown is opened.

properties.name: _parentResizable
properties.desc: The closest ancestor element that implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

properties.name: _positionRect
properties.desc: The bounding rect of the position target.

properties.name: _positionRectMemo
properties.desc:
We memoize the positionTarget bounding rectangle so that we can
limit the number of times it is queried per resize / relayout.

properties.name: _positionTargetChanged
properties.desc: Called when the `positionTarget` property changes.

properties.name: _prepareDropdown
properties.desc:
Prepares the dropdown for opening by updating measured layout
values.

properties.name: _prepareRenderOpened
properties.desc: tasks which must occur before opening; e.g. making the element visible

properties.name: _renderClosed
properties.desc: Overridden from `IronOverlayBehavior`.

properties.name: _renderOpened
properties.desc: Overridden from `IronOverlayBehavior`.

properties.name: _updateAnimationConfig
properties.desc:
Constructs the final animation config from different properties used
to configure specific parts of the opening and closing animations.

properties.name: _updateOverlayPosition
properties.desc:
Updates the overlay position based on configured horizontal
and vertical alignment, and re-memoizes these values for the sake
of behavior in `IronFitBehavior`.

properties.name: _verticalAlignTargetValue
properties.desc: The vertical offset value used to position the dropdown.
